page.title: 04INDUSTRY-AGRICULTURE-HORBURY
page.content: Our area owes much to the industrial revolution of the late eighteenth century and early nineteenth century for its development.By 1820,about two dozen large woollen textile mills were located around the valley of the River Calder,in our area of the Domesday survey.Many of the buildings remain,although the textile boom has long since ended.The old buildings are now used by newer industries.South Osset is remarkable for having developed a unique part of the textile trade-shoddy and mungo- which involves recycling small cloth rags. The industrial landscape of the area is tempered by the abundance of rich agricultural land,dominated by mixed arable farms.These do much to give the appearance of a semi-rural landscape.
